results.title: The Lost Thing: character
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI

results.title: Asking Around
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI
results.brief_description: Shaun Tan (author and co-director)describes some of his original concepts for the book of ‘The Lost Thing’ and how these were translated and changed for the film adaptation. Other interviewees Tom Bryant (3D artist)and Leo Baker (animator)discuss points of similarity and difference between the book and film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI
results.description: Shaun Tan (author and co-director)describes some of his original concepts for the book of ‘The Lost Thing’ and how these were translated and changed for the film adaptation. Other interviewees Tom Bryant (3D artist)and Leo Baker (animator)discuss points of similarity and difference between the book and film.
description_for_label: Shaun Tan (author and co-director)describes some of his original concepts for the book of ‘The Lost Thing’ and how these were translated and changed for the film adaptation. Other interviewees Tom Bryant (3D artist)and Leo Baker (animator)discuss points of similarity and difference between the book and film.

results.title: Hollywood Costume: Interview with Jan Chapman and Janet Patterson
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery, Mike Kenneally and ACMI
results.brief_description:
The 2009 film ‘Bright Star’ (directed by Jane Campion) tells the story of the romance between the English poet John Keats (1795 - 1821) and Fanny Brawne.
In this interview, ‘Bright Star’ producer Jan Chapman and costume designer Janet Patterson discuss the creative process behind costume design, and the design choices that went into making one of the costumes for the character Fanny Brawne (played in the film by Abbie Cornish).
The character’s crimson gown costume was on display during the ACMI Melbourne Winter Masterpieces ‘Hollywood Costume’ exhibition (2013).
Clips from ‘Bright Star’ (2009) courtesy of Hopscotch Films.
results.title_for_label: Hollywood Costume: Interview with Jan Chapman and Janet Patterson
results.creator_credit_for_label: Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery, Mike Kenneally and ACMI

In this interview, ‘Bright Star’ producer Jan Chapman and costume designer Janet Patterson discuss the creative process behind costume design, and the design choices that went into making one of the costumes for the character Fanny Brawne (played in the film by Abbie Cornish).
The character’s crimson gown costume was on display during the ACMI Melbourne Winter Masterpieces ‘Hollywood Costume’ exhibition (2013).

description_for_label:
The 2009 film ‘Bright Star’ (directed by Jane Campion) tells the story of the romance between the English poet John Keats (1795 - 1821) and Fanny Brawne.
In this interview, ‘Bright Star’ producer Jan Chapman and costume designer Janet Patterson discuss the creative process behind costume design, and the design choices that went into making one of the costumes for the character Fanny Brawne (played in the film by Abbie Cornish).
The character’s crimson gown costume was on display during the ACMI Melbourne Winter Masterpieces ‘Hollywood Costume’ exhibition (2013).
Clips from ‘Bright Star’ (2009) courtesy of Hopscotch Films.
